data.text:
Ancestors Descendants

Problems/Questions

Profile last modified 4 Dec 2023 | Created 4 Oct 2014

This page has been accessed 4,428 times.

Biography

Marie-Louise (Habsburg-Lorraine) Bonaparte is Notable.

Marie-Louise, Archduchess of Austria, whose Latin baptismal name was Maria Ludovica Leopoldina Francisca Theresa Josepha Lucia, was the daughter of the last Holy Roman Emperor Francis II and his second wife Maria Theresa. She was born on 12 December 1791 in the Hofburg Palace in Vienna.

She married Napoleon Bonaparte in the Augustinian Church in Vienna on 11 March 1810. Napoleon was not present in person but was represented by Archduke Charles, her uncle.

A son, the future Napoleon II, was born on 20 March 1811.

Marie-Louise twice served nominally as Regent for Napoleon during his wars.

After Napoleon's defeat at Waterloo and exile to St Helena, Marie-Louise was made Duchess of Parma by the Congress of Vienna. She had four children with Adam Albert von Neipperg, and married him on 8 August 1821, after Napoleon's death.

Count von Neipperg died in 1829. On 17 February 1834, Marie-Louise married Charles-René de Bombelles in Parma.

Marie-Louise died in Parma on 17 December 1847. Her body was buried in the Imperial Crypt in Vienna.

Sources
